intro: Bellidiaster, commonly known as the starwort, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that often resemble stars, hence the common name. The plant typically has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped or linear. Bellidiaster species are often found in dry, rocky habitats and are adapted to thrive in arid environments. These plants are generally short-lived perennials or annuals, depending on the species and geographic location.
